intro: Calandrinia acutisepala, commonly known as the acute-lobed portulaca, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Portulacaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to dry conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or red, and they bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Calandrinia acutisepala is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and low maintenance requirements.
